entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower: Scheme of Financial Assistance for Setting Up Anchor Institute
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy aims to bridge the industry’s skill gap, boost employment, and align workforce training with evolving technology and business needs.

fields.schemeName: Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Post-Matric Scholarship for OBC, EBC  and DNT Students for studying in India
fields.briefDescription: "Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Post-Matric Scholarship for OBC, EBC  and DNT Students for studying in India" aims at providing financial assistance to OBC, EWS and DNT students to support their education. The scholarship covers tuition fees, maintenance allowances, and other academic expenses.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension (HPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Disability Pension," introduced by the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HPBOCWWB), Government of Himachal Pradesh, provides a monthly pension of ₹500/- to registered beneficiaries in case of disability caused by accidents or diseases.

fields.schemeName: Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: In the scheme "Mentally Retarded Children Benefit" by the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, an amount of ₹20,000/- per annum is provided to the registered workers to take care of their mentally retarded/disabled children.

fields.schemeName: INDIRAMMA Weavers Pension (Rural)
fields.briefDescription: "INDIRAMMA Weavers Pension (Rural)" scheme aims to disburse monthly pensions to destitute weavers who are 50 years or above in age. To be eligible, they should be from a BPL family, be a resident of the district, and not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Post Matric Scholarship to Lower Income Group Student for Studies in India
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Post Matric Scholarship to Lower Income Group Students for Studies in India" aims to provide financial assistance to students from the Lower Income Groups to enable them to complete their education. Students are provided maintenance allowances, tuition fees, and additional benefits.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Awas Yojna (HPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The Mukhyamantri Awas Yojna, introduced by the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HPBOCWWB), provides financial assistance of ₹1,50,000/- to registered worker.

fields.schemeName: Special Livestock Insurance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Special Livestock Insurance Scheme" is a welfare initiative targeting SC families engaged in livestock rearing. The scheme provides free insurance for livestock, enhancing the economic security of resource-poor SC families. The scheme covers milch animals, sheep, goats, pigs, camels, etc;

fields.schemeName: Goa State Export Market Development Scheme, 2008
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Goa State Export Market Development Scheme" encouraged Goan industries to improve export markets and support them in establishing their goods firmly in the export market. It provided interest-free loans up to ₹5,00,000/- for participating in exhibitions and market study tours abroad.

fields.schemeName: Incentives to Encourage Consumption of Local Raw Material Scheme, 2008
fields.briefDescription: "Incentives to Encourage Consumption of Local Raw Material Scheme, 2008" promoted the use of local raw materials, supporting local manufacturers and village economies. It offered Sales Tax reimbursement and subsidies on power and water bills to eligible Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises.

fields.schemeName: Artisan Promotion
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Artisan Promotion" by the DSFDC provides artisans with opportunities to participate in national fairs and exhibitions. It offers financial support for participation fees, lodging, boarding, and stipends, benefiting artisans from Scheduled Castes, Other Backward Classes, Minorities.

fields.schemeName: Fish Marketing Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Fish Marketing Scheme" by the Fisheries Division, Government of Jharkhand, provides financial support for fish marketing and transportation. Beneficiaries receive subsidies for four-wheeler transport vans and equipment for aquarium shops.

fields.schemeName: Big Loan Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Big Loan Scheme" aims to provide term loans up to ₹5,00,000/- for income-generating activities to eligible applicants from specific targets groups like SC, OBC, Minorities, Safai Karamcharis, and PwDs. The scheme is implemented by DSFDC in collaboration with National Apex Corporations.

fields.schemeName: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance for Interest Subsidy (Service Sector)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana" aims to support SC/ST entrepreneurs and strengthen MSMEs, making them globally competitive.

fields.schemeName: Free Books Scheme for Scheduled Caste Students Pursuing Higher Education
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Govt. of Haryana, on 1st July, 2008, with the aim of attracting SC students towards higher education. Under this scheme, SC students studying in govt. colleges will receive ₹2,000/- per annum for purchasing books.

fields.schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Antyodaya Parivar Suraksha Yojana (DAYALU)
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide socio-financial security to eligible residents of Haryana. The scheme provides financial assistance in the event of death (natural/accidental) or permanent disability (caused by an accident) of a family member whose annual income is less than ₹1.80 lakh.

fields.schemeName: Share Capital to Local Entrepreneurs and Self Employed Scheme, 2008
fields.briefDescription: The "Share Capital to Local Entrepreneurs and Self Employed Scheme, 2008" aimed to encourage local youths to start income-generating activities and promote self-employment. The scheme provided financial support for individuals and groups, covering 50% of the project cost.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Assistance of Capital Investment Subsidy (Manufacturing Sector)
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Financial Support to MSMEs in ZED Certification
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: Interest Subsidy Scheme, 2008
fields.briefDescription: "Interest Subsidy Scheme, 2008" boosted economic growth by providing interest subsidies to Micro and Small Enterprises. The scheme offered financial incentives to new enterprises, making their operations more viable and promoting industrial growth.

fields.schemeName: One Time Settlement (O.T.S.) Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "One Time Settlement (O.T.S.) Scheme" aims to recover outstanding electricity dues from defaulting consumers by offering a waiver of delayed payment charges. Beneficiaries can pay only the principal amount in a lump sum, applicable to consumers with arrears up to ₹20,000/- as of 31-3-2008.

fields.schemeName: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance for Power Connection Charges
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana" aims to support SC/ST entrepreneurs and strengthen MSMEs, making them globally competitive.

fields.schemeName: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance in Rent to MSEs
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana" aims to support SC/ST entrepreneurs and strengthen MSMEs, making them globally competitive.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Overseas Scholarship For Scheduled Caste Etc. Candidates
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by MoSJE for regular, full-time students from Scheduled Castes, Denotified Nomadic and Semi Nomadic Tribes, Landless Agricultural Labourers and Traditional Artisans; to obtain higher education viz., Master degree or Ph.D courses by studying abroad

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Assistance for Power Connection Charges
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.

fields.schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Antyodaya Parivar Suraksha Yojana (DAYALU-II)
fields.briefDescription: The aim of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to residents of Haryana in case of accidental death or permanent disability occurred due to stray cattle/animal such as such as cow, bull, oxen, donkey, dog bite, mule, nilgai and buffalo that roam freely.

fields.schemeName: Annual Medical Assistance Scheme (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The "Annual Medical Assistance Scheme" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides a yearly financial assistance of ₹3,000/- to the construction workers who are registered with the Board.

fields.schemeName: Gujarat Textile Policy: Power Tariff Subsidy
fields.briefDescription: The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

fields.schemeName: Schemes for welfare of School Children belonging to BPL and BC(A) families: Monthly Stipend for BC-A Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from Backward Classes (BC-A) families to support their education. Under this scheme, eligible students studying in Classes 1 to 12 in Haryana Government schools receive a monthly stipend.

fields.schemeName: Additional Financial Assistance for the Children of Persons Engaged in the Cleaning Profession
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to provide additional financial assistance of ₹500/- per month to children of individuals working in cleaning/sanitation profession. This assistance is given to students already receiving a scholarship under Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme, ensuring their continued education.

fields.schemeName: HSCST Fellowship Programme
fields.briefDescription: In order to attract talented & meritorious students, HSCSIT is offering research fellowships in various fields of Science & Technology & Medical Sciences. The fellowships will involve full time research work leading to Ph.D. degree from any of the Institute/University in Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Gujarat Textile Policy: Capital Subsidy (Fiscal Incentives to Labour Intensive Unit)
fields.briefDescription: The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

fields.schemeName: Devnarayan Gurukul Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide free residential education to students from Special Backward Classes. Under this scheme, selected students receive free education, accommodation, meals, uniforms, books, and study materials in government-approved schools.

fields.schemeName: Gujarat Textile Policy: Assistance for Technology Acquisition
fields.briefDescription: The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

fields.schemeName: Interest Subvention Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide institutional credit for capital investments at reasonable interest rates and is implemented through the Karnataka State Financial Corporation (KSFC) in the state.

fields.schemeName: Kisan Vriksha Mitra Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote commercial tree plantation on private lands, ensuring buyback of produce, increasing farmers' income, and generating employment. The scheme benefits farmers, private institutions, and other stakeholders by providing financial assistance for plantation.

fields.schemeName: Vishesh Yogyajan Sukhad Dampatya Jeevan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to specially-abled individuals to support a happy married life after marriage. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000/- per couple is provided.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Persons with Disabilities for Purchase/Fitting of Artificial Limbs/Appliances
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹10,000/- to specially-abled individuals for self-employment and the purchase of artificial limbs/equipment to overcome physical disabilities.

fields.schemeName: AFFDF-Financial Assistance For Treatment Of Serious Diseases To Non Pensioner Ex-Servicemen (All Ranks)/Widows
fields.briefDescription: A scheme to provide financial assistance to a non-pensioner Ex-Servicemen of all ranks and widows to meet medical expenses related to treatment of approved serious diseases like cancer, renal failure, knee replacement and heart surgery.

fields.schemeName: Group Insurance Scheme for Powerloom Weavers
fields.briefDescription: The basic objective of this scheme is to provide insurance cover to the powerloom weavers in the case of natural death, accidental death as well as partial and permanent disability due to accident.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance on Marriage of Sons- Haryana Silicosis Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹11,000/- is provided to workers suffering from silicosis, as confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, for the marriage of up to two of their sons.

fields.schemeName: Promotion of Science Education (POSE) Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage meritorious students to pursue higher studies in Basic and Natural Science subjects, such as B.Sc., B.S., B.Stat., B.Math., Integrated M.Sc., or M.S., in India. The scheme is implemented by the Haryana State Council for Science, Innovation & Technology.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for assistance for Start Ups/ Innovation: Sustenance Allowance
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Assistance for Start Ups/ Innovation" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy, aims to drive economic growth by generating jobs, fostering competition, and introducing next-gen solutions.

fields.schemeName: Divyang Boys/ Girls Marriage Incentive Grant
fields.briefDescription: “Divyang Youth / Girl Marriage Incentive Grant” is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance to a couple when a young woman or young man marries a Divyang (person with disability) partner.

fields.schemeName: Mother Teresa Asahay Matri Sambal Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The main purpose of the Scheme to encourage under this Yojana, women who are helpless in upbringing their children (like widows, and destitute) are provided with financial assistance per child per annum for two children.

fields.schemeName: Mobility Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Mobility Scheme is aimed to provide an opportunity to women scientists who are facing difficulties in their present job due to relocation (marriage, transfer of husband to any other location within the country, attending ailing parents, and accompanying children studying in different city).

fields.schemeName: Pre Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Tribe Students
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Tribal Affairs for regular, full time students from Scheduled Tribe studying in Class 9th and 10th, in a Government School or in a School recognized by Govt. or a Central/State Board of Secondary Education.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides free food grain through the Public Distribution System, to all the priority households (ration card holders and those identified by the Antyodaya Anna Yojana scheme) - Migrants and the Poor.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: ICAR National Professor And National Fellow
fields.briefDescription: To promote excellence by recognizing outstanding scientists with proven output and outcomes for creating a culture of basic research through their project work in the National Agricultural Research System (NARS).

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Students Ready
fields.briefDescription: The Student Rural Entrepreneurship Awareness Development Yojana (READY)  was launched by Hon'ble Prime Minister on 25 July 2015.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres Scheme
fields.briefDescription: A welfare scheme by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare was launched in 2002. AC&ABC aims at agricultural development, supplementing the efforts of public extension by providing extension and other services to farmers either on a payment basis or free of cost as per the business model.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Netaji Subhas - ICAR International Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: Introduced in 2009-10, the “Netaji Subhas - ICAR International Fellowship” is a scheme by to develop competent human resource that are trained in the identified best laboratories in the world (for Indian candidates) and similarly expose overseas candidates to the best Agriculture Universities.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Provide Assistance to Sate Market Committees as well as Taluka-District Co-operative Purchase and Sale Union to Construct Large Size Warehouse Godowns
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to State Market Committees and Taluka-District Co-operative Purchase and Sale Unions for constructing large-sized warehouse godowns

fields.schemeName: State Government Share Capital Contribution to Co.operative Sugar Factories (Normal Area) (Tribal Area)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance in the form of a 30% share capital contribution by the State Government for setting up new sugar cooperative factories in Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Maternity Benefit
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance to a beneficiary on successful delivery of a child or miscarriage by such beneficiary or his wife.

fields.schemeName: Grant Scheme for Marriage of SC and ST Girls
fields.briefDescription: “Grant Scheme for Marriage of SC and ST Girls” is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance to the SC and ST girls to cover the expenses of marriage.

fields.schemeName: Post Matric Scholarship For Minorities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Minority Affairs for students from minority communities pursuing a post-matric course from a notified institution in India in a government or private school. A total of five (5) lakh scholarships are targeted to be distributed as ‘Fresh’ Scholarships.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for MSME Sector: Assistance For Patent Registration /Trade Mark Registration
fields.briefDescription: “Assistance For Patent Registration/ Trade Mark Registration” under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for MSME sector, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, aims to extend support for obtaining Patent Registration/ Trade Mark Registration.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Assistance For Marble, IT & ITES, Electric Vehicles & Spare Parts, Toys Units And Semi-Conduct or Industries Sectors
fields.briefDescription: “Assistance For Marble, IT & ITES, Electric Vehicles & Spare Parts, Toys Units And Semi-Conduct or Industries Sectors'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for Thrust Sectors, by the Dept. of Industries,  DNH & DD, aims to promote industries through providing various types of subsidy.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) For Handicraft Artisans: Assistance For Capital Investment To Uplift The Economic Condition Of Artisans/ Persons
fields.briefDescription: This is a sub-scheme under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)”, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, that aims to provide additional tools/equipment to SC/ST/OBC/EWS communities to generate adequate income and self-employment.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Scheme For Vaccine Manufacturing Units
fields.briefDescription: “ Scheme For Vaccine Manufacturing Units'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for Thrust Sectors, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, aims to provide Interest Subsidy to Vaccine Manufacturing Units.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS): Scheme For Reimbursement Of Stamp Duty
fields.briefDescription: “Scheme For Reimbursement Of Stamp Duty'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)”, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, aims to provide reimbursement on Stamp duty to the new units as well as the units undertaking expansion/ diversification.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme to Disabled Persons (Divyangjan)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Social Welfare Department to provide financial assistance to individuals with disabilities. The primary objective is to provide financial benefits to eligible Divyangjan to cater to their basic needs. The scheme is targeted at Divyangjan aged between 18 to 59 years.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Ex-gratia for Permanent Disability/ Chronic Diseases/ Surgery/ Operation for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: "Ex-gratia for Permanent Disability/ Chronic Diseases/ Surgery/ Operation for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Dept.,  U.T. of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for Permanent Disability/ Chronic Diseases/ Surgery/ Operation of the workers.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Grant for the Purchase of Tools/ Protective Gear for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Grant for the Purchase of Tools/ Protective Gear for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to the eligible registered member for purchase of tools.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Promoting Registration for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Promoting Registration for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, U.T. of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides sleeping mat/ blanket/ mosquito net to registered construction workers, in order to encourage construction workers to register with the Board.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Pension for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Pension for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides a monthly pension after completion of 60 years to the eligible registered member.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Saraswati Vidya Yojana: Reimbursement of Fees for Diploma/Graduation and Post-Graduation Professional Courses
fields.briefDescription: “Reimbursement of Fees for Diploma/ Graduation and Post-Graduation Professional Courses'' under “Saraswati Vidya Yojana”, implemented by the Directorate of Education,  Of DNH & DD, aims to provide financial assistance to girl students pursuing higher education in professional courses.

fields.schemeName: Agricultural Skill Development Training Programme For Women Farmers And Farmers
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Agricultural Skill Development Training Programme for Women Farmers and Farmers” was started by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Gaon Ki Beti
fields.briefDescription: MP Gaon Ki Beti Yojna 2022-23 is a scholarship provided by the Madhya Pradesh government. The MP state government has started this scheme to encourage the higher education of girl children in remote areas in 2005.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to Purchase Solar Power Unit/Kit for Solar Fencing around the Farm
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for purchasing solar power units/kits for solar fencing around their farms to protect crops from damage caused by wild and stray animals.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to Farmers for Purchasing Sanedo Agricultural Equipment
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for purchasing Sanedo (Mini Tractor) equipment, which enhances efficiency and reduces labor dependency in farming operations.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance on Purchase of Smartphone by the Farmers
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for purchasing smartphones, enabling them to access agricultural technology, weather updates, pest control techniques, and government assistance.

fields.schemeName: Farmers Accidental Insurance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to the families of registered farmers in the event of accidental death or disability.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Assistance to Scheduled Tribe Farmers to Increase the Area, Production and Productivity of Sugarcane Farming
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to ST farmers to increase sugarcane production and productivity through quality seeds, modern farming practices, and agricultural mechanization.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance For Marriage (APB&OCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Marriage” was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for the registered workers of Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).

fields.schemeName: Economic Help To Tribal Girls For Higher Education (Class 11 & 12)
fields.briefDescription: Rajasthan Government started a scholarship for tribal girls higher education (Class 11 & 12) In the year 2011.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Tamil Nadu introduced "Marriage Assistance"  for the employees or their Son/Daughter who legally attain the age of marriage.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for the Treatment of Blind, Disabled, Deaf, Dumb, or Mentally Challenged Ex-Servicemen and their Dependents (Wife and Children)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance for the treatment of ex-servicemen and their dependents (wife & children) who have a disability of 40% or more and are suffering from serious illnesses such as cancer, leprosy, tuberculosis, kidney and cardiac ailments, paralysis, etc.

fields.schemeName: Devnarayan Pratibhawan Chhatra Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage academic excellence among students belonging to Special Backward Classes (SBC). It provides an annual financial incentive of ₹3,500/- to students pursuing education from Class 10th to postgraduate level in government schools or colleges.

fields.schemeName: Establishment of 50 Milch Animals Dairy Unit
fields.briefDescription: The "Establishment of 50 Milch Animals Dairy Unit" scheme introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to livestock owners for setting up dairy farms, ensuring sustainable dairy production.

fields.schemeName: Shagun Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Shagun Yojana" aims to assist BPL families with financial aid for the marriage of their daughters. A grant of ₹31,000 is provided to the girl/women.

fields.schemeName: Reimbursement of Tution Fee for SC/ST/OBC/Min students in Public Schools in Class I to XII
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial support by reimbursing tuition and compulsory fees for SC/ST/OBC students from low-income families (below ₹3,00,000/- per annum) studying in recognized schools in Delhi. Beneficiaries must meet academic and attendance criteria.

fields.schemeName: BC & EBC Girls Residential +2 High School
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide quality education and holistic development opportunities for girls from backward and extremely backward classes. Free education, accommodation, study material, medical support, and skill development programs are provided.

fields.schemeName: Scholarships For Higher Education Abroad To Meritorious Boys And Girls From Open Category
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scholarships for Higher Education Abroad to Meritorious Boys and Girls from open category” was launched by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Maharashtra on 4th October 2018.

fields.schemeName: The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibition Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage local youths in photography and photojournalism, providing cash prizes and exhibition opportunities. The scheme offers cash prizes of ₹20,000/-, ₹16,000/-, and ₹12,000/- in each category. Entries from applicants born and residing in Goa are preferred.

fields.schemeName: The Goa State Journalist Awards Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "The Goa State Journalist Awards Scheme" aims to encourage journalists to publish commendable news items, articles, or reports, fostering mass awareness. It provides awards, including a cash prize of ₹10,000/-, to eligible journalists in Goa.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship/Merit scholarship to OBC/MIN/SC/ST students from Class I to XII
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from SC/ST/OBC/Minority communities studying in classes I to XII in government or recognised schools in Delhi. The scheme offers varying scholarship amounts based on class and academic performance, ensuring support for education.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy for School Uniforms to the Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide cash subsidies for school uniforms to students from Nursery to Class XII in government and aided schools. Benefits include annual payments ranging from ₹1,100/- to ₹1,500/-, ensuring financial support for all eligible students.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, is designed to help farmers reduce fodder wastage and improve their dairy farming efficiency.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit Scheme (APB&OCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh has proposed and implemented the scheme “Maternity Benefit Scheme” for Registered Workers of Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Professional/Technical Training
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, vocational/technical training is provided to Palanhar beneficiary boys & girls through recognized training providers such as the Rajasthan Skill & Livelihood Development Corporation, Rajasthan Knowledge Corporation Ltd., it is etc. recognized by the State or Central Govt.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Self-Employment/Business
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, eligible boys and girls receive financial assistance in two installments - 60% initially and 40% later, to establish self-employment or business ventures. The support is specifically linked to the training course completed by the beneficiary.

fields.schemeName: To Provide Interest Subvention to Fishermen of the State at the Rate of 4% to the Beneficiaries Kishan Credit Card
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide 4% interest subvention to the fishermen in Gujarat on timely repayment of short-term loans taken through the Kisan Credit Card.

fields.schemeName: Theatre Workshop
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide scientific knowledge of theatre to upcoming theatre artistes through an expert theatre personality. The workshops are organised on the written request of institutions working in the field of theatre and educational institutions for their students.

fields.schemeName: Managerial Assistance Scheme for Appointment of Veterinarian
fields.briefDescription: The "Managerial Assistance Scheme for Appointment of Veterinarian" provides financial support to registered Panjrapols for appointing a qualified veterinarian to ensure proper medical care, vaccination, and scientific record-keeping for animals housed in Gaushalas/ Panjrapols.

fields.schemeName: Children's Drawing Painting Competition
fields.briefDescription: The "Children's Drawing and Painting Competition", organized by the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Goa, aims to encourage creativity and artistic expression among Goan children and to develop a healthy competitive spirit at a young age.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance for the marriage of a registered female worker herself (including one-time remarriage) and for up to two daughters of a registered worker. The scheme applies to the marriage of the female beneficiary herself and the legal, adopted, or stepdaughter of worker.

fields.schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Caste Category)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free BIS type II concentrate feed to pregnant cattle owned by Scheduled Caste Category livestock owners in Gujarat to ensure their good health, boost immunity, prevent metabolic diseases, and enhance milk production.

fields.schemeName: COP-5 Financial Assistance to Agricultural Credit Co-operative Banks (PACS/LAMPS) for Reconstruction and Reestablishment (General/Tribal Area)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to Primary Agricultural Credit Societies (PACS) and Large-sized Agricultural Multi-Purpose Societies (LAMPS) in General and Tribal areas to strengthen their economic viability and ensure their continued contribution to the cooperative credit structure.
